title: 107_s1129
content: PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN OFFICES AND POSITIONS WITHIN THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH. Provisions regarding adjustments to Executive Schedule pay rates based on comparability payments for General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia. Adjustments are made at the beginning of the first pay period after the first day of the month in which the comparability payment becomes payable. The annual rate of pay for Executive Schedule positions is adjusted based on the percentage adjustment for General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia. The annual rate of pay for Executive Schedule positions is adjusted based on the percentage adjustment for General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia. Adjustments under this subsection are scheduled to take effect before adjustments under subsection (a). The adjusted annual rate of pay shall be treated as the official rate for the positions involved. The annual rate of pay for Executive Schedule positions is adjusted based on the percentage adjustment for General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia. Contract appeals board members' rates of basic pay are also adjusted accordingly. The rates of basic pay for contract appeals board members are adjusted each month under section 5303. Section 5318 of title 5, United States Code, is amended to make conforming changes. Amendments relating to certain limitations and provisions are also made. Amendments are made to sections 5303(f), 5304(h)(1)(F), 5306(e), and 5373(a) of title 5, United States Code, excluding any adjustment under section 5318(b). Section 5307(a) is amended to include limitations on certain payments for specific categories of employees receiving basic pay under different sections. Amendments are made to sections 5303(f), 5304(h)(1)(F), 5306(e), and 5373(a) of title 5, United States Code, excluding any adjustment under section 5318(b). References to level IV of the executive schedule in various sections are changed to level III. Amendments are made to certain offices and positions within the judicial branch. Amendments are made to increase maximum rates of basic pay for certain positions within the judicial branch, including positions covered by section 604(a)(5) of title 28, circuit executives, and personnel of the administrative office of the United States courts. Amendments to the United States courts personnel act and the salary of the Director of the Administrative Office of the United States Courts are made by adjusting levels and positions within the judicial branch. The amendments made by this Act will be effective for pay periods starting on or after the enactment date.
